question: 汚す
userAnswer:
<tag>よご:</tag>to{} dirty/stain/soil | defile/slur/taint | pollute/contaminate | dress
<tag>けが:</tag>to{} defile/disgrace/dishonor/descecrate | pollute/contaminate/soil | be-unworthy-of(position)
activeAnswer:
<tag>よご:</tag>to{} dirty/stain/soil | defile/slur/taint | pollute/contaminate | dress
<tag>けが:</tag>to{} defile/disgrace/dishonor/descecrate | pollute/contaminate/soil | be-unworthy-of(position)
sourceMnemonic: <ja>汚れる</ja> is "to get dirty." This is when you make something dirty, aka "<vocabulary>to make dirty</vocabulary>." You know that this is the version where you make things dirty yourself because when you make someone dirty with all that poop you're flinging, they <reading>sue</reading> (<ja>す</ja>) you immediately. This happens a lot.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
The reading comes from <ja>汚れる</ja>, so if you know that you can read this.

Note that the reading <ja>よごす</ja>  is generally used for making things physically dirty, whereas <ja>けがす</ja> means making someone or something impure in a figurative way.
